span.title: Article Title: Please Request and Vote For the Renewal of the Emergency Levy

h3.span: Please Request and Vote For the Renewal of the Emergency Levy

img.span: "Please continue your support of Arcadia Local Schools and vote for the renewal of the four year $440,000 emergency levy. Absentee ballots can be obtained from the Hancock County Board of Elections."

span.div: Click Here to Request Absentee Ballot for the 2020 Primary

span.title: Article Title: Updated Drop-Off and Pick-Up Schedule Starting, Monday, April 6th !!!

h3.span: Updated Drop-Off and Pick-Up Schedule Starting, Monday, April 6th !!!

li.strong: Arcadia Schools will resume drop-off and pick-up of assignments for those teachers and students who are not engaged via online instruction on Monday, April 6th.

ul.li: Elementary packets will be available for pick-up and drop-off in the lobby of the elementary new addition drop-off doors every Monday and Tuesday from 1 pm to 7 pm.
High/Middle School packets will be available at the front main entrance every Monday and Tuesdays from 1 pm to 7 pm.
These limited times and areas will allows the district to disinfect a specific controlled area and parents can view the area before entering to better maintain appropriate distances and contact.
Please email your students teacher or building principal if your student requires an electronic device. We will make arrangements to get the device to you.

Grade cards will be available to parents at the end of this week using Progressbook Parent Access Accounts. Please scroll down for directions to obtain information to create a Parent Access Account or request username and password for a current Parent Access Account.
All teachers and principals are available by email to help resolve any challenges you encounter.
Be safe, supportive and positive and we will overcome this current challenge together.

span.title: Article Title: Arcadia Local Schools Will Be Posting Grade Cards To Progressbook

h3.span: Arcadia Local Schools Will Be Posting Grade Cards To Progressbook

div.span: For the safety of all, Arcadia Local Schools will be posting grade cards to Progressbook.
div.strong: Therefore each parent will need a Progressbook Parent Access Account to view the grade card
div.span: . If information is needed to create a Parent Access Account or log in to a current Parent Access Account, please click the link below and complete the form. Mr. Mckee will email the necessary information. A separate form will need to be completed for each student. The parent access link is located under parent/student resources tab and at the bottom of the right hand column on the home page of the school website. A pdf and screen shot showing steps to creating the parent access account is available on the parent/student resources page.

span.title: Article Title: Arrangements have been made to provide meals to any student

h3.span: Arrangements have been made to provide meals to any student

span.div: The communities of Fostoria and Findlay have made arrangements for meals to be provided to any student. If anyone knows of additional assistance being offered to families, please notify the school and we will update the information on the webpage.
The following are being offered in Findlay:

We Serve Coffee is donating lunches. Students can ask for "Lunches with Love," no questions asked 567-525-4680.
There are free little pantries scattered across Findlay.
AJ's Heavenly Pizza is donating a pizza slice and water for lunch.
Chopin Hall is hosting a drive thru program. 419-422-6401
The City Mission is open each day for anyone who needs a hot meal. A sack lunch will be provided to Children Lunch is served 11:30 - 1:00 pm Monday - Saturday. Dinner is served from 5:00-6:00 pm 7 days a week. 419-423-9151

div.span: INTERESTED IN A SUBSTITUTE POSITION? Renhill Group manages the recruiting and placing of substitute teachers for Arcadia Local Schools. For assistance, call Renhill Group directly at 419-254-2814.
